description: Unknown, first attested 1849. Suggested derivations are:
Online Etymological Dictionary's entry cites in 1857, the Saturday Review (London newspaper) noted, "the word has a certain Coptic or Egyptian twang".

entries.meaning: A personal name or nickname; an informal label, often drawing attention to a particular attribute.
examples: Synonyms: byname, nickname, pseudonym, sobriquet, street name, to-name; see also Thesaurus:name
The rookie was upset at being called Lemon Drop until she realized that everyone on the team had a silly moniker.

entries.meaning: (computing) An object (structured item of data) used to associate the name of an object with its location.
examples: Monikers are often composed from other monikers to allow object hierarchies to be navigated based on a textual description of a path.
